intro: Saccolabium ochraceum, commonly known as the yellow sicklepod, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Australia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its yellow flowers and compound leaves. The plant produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. It is well adapted to drought conditions, with deep roots and a low, spreading growth habit. Saccolabium ochraceum is often found in sandy soils and can thrive in harsh environmental conditions.
